etymology.type: simplified from cursive form of 頭
etymology.description: Simplified from 頭: 豆 (phonetic) → ⺀; 頁/页 (semantic “head”) → 大. Traditional 頭 is phono-semantic: semantic 頁 + phonetic 豆.
etymology.interpretation: A cursive abbreviation of 頭 where the original phonetic 豆 was reduced to a dot-like stroke and the semantic 頁/页 was streamlined to 大. The simplification preserves overall silhouette while dropping the original phonetic-semantic clarity.
etymology.simplification: Cursive-derived stroke reduction to ease writing: 豆 → ⺀ and 頁/页 → 大; merges and streamlines parts of 頭.

examples.chinese: 他站在队伍的最前头(他站在隊伍的最前頭)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zhàn zài duìwu de zuì qián tou.
examples.english: He is standing at the very front of the line.

examples.chinese: 这条路的尽头是海边(這條路的盡頭是海邊)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè tiáo lù de jìntóu shì hǎibiān.
examples.english: At the end of this road is the seaside.
